Title: Assignment 1: Problem Statement & Rationale
Description: Draft a clear problem statement with background and justification.

Title: Assignment 2: Literature Mapping
Description: Build a preliminary literature map and identify key themes and seminal works.

Title: Assignment 3: Research Questions & Objectives
Description: Formulate aligned research questions, objectives, and hypotheses where relevant.

Title: Assignment 4: Methodology Draft
Description: Outline qualitative/quantitative approach, design, variables, and measures.

Title: Assignment 5: Ethics Application Prep
Description: Compile consent forms, risk assessment, participant info sheets, and ethics checklist.

Title: Assignment 6: Sampling & Instrument Design
Description: Design sampling strategy and draft a data-collection instrument (survey/interview guide).

Title: Semester Test 2: Methodology & Ethics
Description: Focus on sampling, measurement, instrumentation, and ethical considerations.

Title: Assignment 8: Data Collection Plan
Description: Timeline, resources, permissions, and procedures for data collection.

Title: Assignment 9: Proposal Consolidation
Description: Integrate feedback and produce a cohesive, referenced proposal draft.

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Research Methods
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment on Semester 1 material.

Title: Assignment 2: Personas & Scenarios
Description: Create personas and usage scenarios grounded in user research findings.

Title: Assignment 3: Task Analysis
Description: Model key tasks using HTA or user flow diagrams and identify pain points.

Title: Semester Test 1: HCI Principles & Perception
Description: Test on cognition, perception, and core interaction principles.

Title: Assignment 4: Low-Fidelity Prototypes
Description: Sketch wireframes/paper prototypes for core user flows; include annotations.

Title: Assignment 5: Usability Test Plan
Description: Define metrics, tasks, participants, and protocol for a usability study.

Title: Assignment 6: Interaction Patterns Review
Description: Compare design patterns and justify choices for consistency and learnability.

Title: Semester Test 2: Prototyping & Evaluation
Description: Focus on prototyping fidelity, evaluation methods, and study design.

Title: Assignment 7: Accessibility Audit
Description: Assess WCAG compliance of a chosen interface and propose fixes.

Title: Assignment 8: High-Fidelity Prototype
Description: Build a clickable prototype incorporating prior feedback and accessibility fixes.

Title: Assignment 9: Usability Report
Description: Summarise study findings, quantitative metrics, and design recommendations.

Title: Supplementary Test 3: HCI Comprehensive
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment across Semester 1 content.

Title: Assignment 1: Dimensional Modeling Basics
Description: Identify facts, dimensions, grain, and conformed dimensions for a case study.

Title: Assignment 2: ETL Pipeline Design
Description: Outline extraction, transformation, and loading steps with error handling.

Title: Assignment 3: Star vs Snowflake Modeling
Description: Model both schemas for the same use case and justify design choices.

Title: Semester Test 1: DW Concepts & Dimensional Modeling
Description: Test on Kimball vs Inmon, SCD types, schema design, and grain selection.

Title: Assignment 4: Data Quality & Profiling
Description: Profile sample data, define cleansing rules, and propose quality KPIs.

Title: Assignment 5: Staging & Scheduling
Description: Design staging area and orchestrate job schedules with dependencies.

Title: Assignment 6: Indexing & Partitioning Plan
Description: Plan indexing, partitioning, and aggregation strategies for performance.

Title: Semester Test 2: ETL & Performance
Description: Focus on ETL orchestration, error handling, and workload tuning.

Title: Assignment 7: OLAP Cube Design
Description: Design dimensions, hierarchies, and measures for a small OLAP cube.

Title: Assignment 8: SQL for Analytics
Description: Write analytic queries using window functions, CTEs, and rollups.

Title: Assignment 9: Dashboard Specification
Description: Specify KPIs and visualisations for a BI dashboard backed by the star schema.

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Data Warehousing
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment across Semester 1 topics.

Title: Assignment 1: Threat Modelling Basics
Description: Construct a simple STRIDE-based threat model for a given system.

Title: Assignment 2: Cryptography Primer
Description: Explain symmetric vs asymmetric crypto with key management considerations.

Title: Assignment 3: Access Control & Policy
Description: Design RBAC roles and a sample security policy for a departmental app.

Title: Semester Test 1: Information Security Fundamentals
Description: Test on core principles, cryptography basics, and access control models.

Title: Assignment 4: Network Security Lab
Description: Mini lab on firewalls/IDS/IPS configuration and packet inspection notes.

Title: Assignment 5: Secure Coding Review
Description: Identify and fix common vulnerabilities (input validation, injection, XSS).

Title: Assignment 6: Risk Assessment Plan
Description: Perform a qualitative risk assessment and propose mitigation strategies.

Title: Semester Test 2: Applied Security & Compliance
Description: Focus on network security, secure coding, governance and compliance.

Title: Assignment 7: Incident Response Playbook
Description: Draft an IR plan with roles, triage, containment, eradication, and recovery steps.

Title: Assignment 8: Vulnerability Scan & Report
Description: Run a scan on a sample environment and produce a prioritised remediation report.

Title: Assignment 9: Security Awareness Artefact
Description: Create a one-page security awareness guide for non-technical staff.

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Security
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment covering Semester 1 content.

Title: Assignment 1: Kotlin & Compose Layouts
Description: Implement core Compose layouts and basic state handling.

Title: Assignment 2: REST & Retrofit
Description: Consume a REST API with Retrofit and handle errors gracefully.

Title: Assignment 3: Room Persistence
Description: Create a Room database with DAOs and simple offline caching.

Title: Semester Test 1: Mobile Dev Foundations
Description: Test on Kotlin, Compose basics, app architecture, and networking.

Title: Assignment 4: State & ViewModel
Description: Introduce ViewModel, remember/derivedState, and UI state restoration.

Title: Assignment 5: Navigation & Deep Links
Description: Set up Navigation, parameter passing, and app deep links.

Title: Assignment 6: WorkManager & Background Tasks
Description: Schedule background work with constraints and observe progress.

Title: Semester Test 2: Advanced Android Patterns
Description: Focus on state management, navigation, background work, and testing.

Title: Assignment 7: Performance Profiling
Description: Profile app performance and fix jank/memory issues.

Title: Assignment 8: Accessibility & UX Polish
Description: Enhance accessibility semantics and improve UI polish based on heuristics.

Title: Assignment 9: Release Readiness
Description: Prepare signing, app bundles, and Play Console artefacts (mock).

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Mobile Dev
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment covering Semester 1 content.

Title: Assignment 1: Modern Web Stack
Description: Set up tooling (package manager, bundler) and project structure.

Title: Assignment 2: RESTful API Design
Description: Design endpoints and an OpenAPI spec for a small service.

Title: Assignment 3: Auth & JWT
Description: Implement signup/login with JWT-based auth and refresh tokens (mock).

Title: Semester Test 1: Web Foundations & HTTP
Description: Test on HTTP, REST, caching, and modern frontend architecture.

Title: Assignment 4: SSR vs SPA
Description: Compare SSR and SPA trade-offs; implement a minimal SSR route.

Title: Assignment 5: Caching & CDN Strategy
Description: Plan HTTP caching, ETags, and a CDN setup for static assets.

Title: Assignment 6: Web Security & OWASP
Description: Mitigate OWASP Top 10 issues; add CSRF and CSP protections.

Title: Semester Test 2: Full-Stack Patterns & Optimisation
Description: Focus on API design, performance, and security hardening.

Title: Assignment 7: Realtime Feature (WebSockets)
Description: Add a realtime notification feature with a small demo.

Title: Assignment 8: CI/CD Pipeline
Description: Create a simple pipeline with automated tests and deployment (mock).

Title: Assignment 9: Monitoring & Logging
Description: Set up basic monitoring and logging dashboards; add alerts (mock).

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Internet Programming
Description: Comprehensive re-assessment covering Semester 1 content.

Title: Assignment 1: Exploratory Data Analysis & Data Audit
Description: Profile the dataset, identify data quality issues, and summarise key distributions with visuals.

Title: Assignment 2: Feature Engineering & Cleaning Notebook
Description: Engineer features (encoding, scaling, imputations) and document choices in a reproducible notebook.

Title: Assignment 3: Baseline Models (Regression/Classification)
Description: Train baseline models with proper splits; report metrics and error analysis.

Title: Semester Test 1: Probability, Statistics & ML Foundations
Description: Closed-book test covering distributions, estimation, bias/variance and basic ML.

Title: Assignment 4: Model Selection & Cross-Validation
Description: Compare models using k-fold CV and tune hyperparameters responsibly.

Title: Assignment 5: Unsupervised Learning (Clustering/Dim-Red)
Description: Apply clustering and PCA/TSNE; interpret structures and evaluate stability.

Title: Assignment 6: ML Pipeline & Model Cards
Description: Package a full pipeline with preprocessing; produce a model card with risks/limits.

Title: Semester Test 2: Advanced ML & Evaluation
Description: Assessment on ensembles, calibration, ROC/PR analysis, and error diagnostics.

Title: Assignment 7: Time Series Forecasting Mini-Project
Description: Build seasonal models; evaluate forecast accuracy and uncertainty.

Title: Assignment 8: Deep Learning Fundamentals (CNN/RNN)
Description: Train a small DL model; report architecture, training curves and overfitting controls.

Title: Assignment 9: Responsible AI & Explainability
Description: Apply XAI tools (e.g., SHAP/LIME) and discuss fairness, privacy, and robustness.

Title: Supplementary Test 3: Comprehensive Data Science Exam
Description: Three-hour capstone exam covering the full syllabus.

Title: Assignment 1: Financial Statement Analysis & Ratios
Description: Analyse an annual report and compute profitability, liquidity and solvency ratios.

Title: Assignment 2: Budgeting & Variance Analysis
Description: Prepare an operating budget and reconcile variances with managerial insights.

Title: Assignment 3: Cost of Capital (WACC) Estimation
Description: Estimate WACC using market data; justify assumptions for debt/equity costs.

Title: Semester Test 1: Financial Accounting & Analysis
Description: Test on statements, ratio interpretation, and cash flow analysis.

Title: Assignment 4: Capital Budgeting (NPV/IRR)
Description: Evaluate project options under different discount rates and risk scenarios.

Title: Assignment 5: Working Capital Management
Description: Propose policies for inventory, receivables, and payables; compute cash cycles.

Title: Assignment 6: Risk & Return (CAPM)
Description: Estimate beta, expected returns, and discuss portfolio implications.

Description: Assessment on capital structure, valuation methods, and payout policy.

Title: Assignment 7: Financing Decisions & Capital Structure
Description: Analyse leverage trade-offs and propose a target structure.

Title: Assignment 8: Dividend Policy & Payout Strategies
Description: Compare residual, stable, and hybrid payout approaches with scenarios.

Description: Compute EVA and outline a Balanced Scorecard for a chosen firm.

Description: Three-hour supplementary assessment covering the full module.

Description: Define 6–8 KPIs for a chosen domain and map each to reliable data sources.

Description: Design an incremental ETL pipeline (staging → warehouse) with schedule and failure handling.

Description: Create dashboard wireframes and a mock dataset to validate metric calculations.
